options.label: C

title: How hormones work

multiple-choice.question: What is one thing that is often misunderstood about hormones?

options.text: They are only related to sex and reproduction.

options.label: B
options.text: They are only found in the nervous system.

options.label: C
options.text: They are only made up of amino acids.

options.label: D
options.text: They are only produced by the pituitary gland.

multiple-choice.question: What is the difference between the nervous system and the endocrine system?

options.label: A
options.text: The nervous system uses electrical signals, while the endocrine system uses hormones.

options.label: B
options.text: The nervous system is faster, while the endocrine system is slower.

options.label: C
options.text: The nervous system is made up of neurons, while the endocrine system is made up of glands.

options.label: D
options.text: The nervous system is only found in the brain, while the endocrine system is found throughout the body.

multiple-choice.question: What is the HPA axis, and what is its role in the body?

options.label: A
options.text: The HPA axis is a hormone cascade that regulates digestion and immune response.

options.label: B
options.text: The HPA axis is a complex series of interactions between three glands that regulates stress response.

options.label: C
options.text: The HPA axis is a hormone that helps to regulate blood sugar levels.

options.label: D
options.text: The HPA axis is a gland that produces hormones related to sex and reproduction.

multiple-choice.question: What happens when the hypothalamus senses the stress hormones in the blood?

options.label: A
options.text: It secretes more CRH, which causes the other glands to secrete more panic hormones.

options.label: B
options.text: It stops secreting CRH, which causes the other glands to stop secreting their panic hormones.

options.label: C
options.text: It increases the production of glucocorticoid and mineralcorticoid hormones.

options.label: D
options.text: It decreases the production of insulin and glucagon.

multiple-choice.question: What is the role of the adrenal glands in the HPA axis?

options.label: A
options.text: They produce hormones that help to regulate blood sugar levels.

options.label: B
options.text: They produce hormones that help to regulate blood pressure and immune response.

options.label: C
options.text: They produce hormones that help to regulate the fight-or-flight response.

options.label: D
options.text: They produce hormones that help to regulate digestion and sperm and egg development.

options.text: The United States' demand for the removal of Soviet missiles from Cuba.

options.label: D
options.text: The conflict between the United States and the Soviet Union over the control of Cuba.

multiple-choice.question: What was the proposal reached by Attorney General Robert Kennedy and Soviet Ambassador Anatoly Dobrynin during the Cuban Missile Crisis?

options.label: A
options.text: The United States would remove its missiles from Turkey and Italy in exchange for the Soviet withdrawal from Cuba.

options.label: B
options.text: The Soviet Union would remove its missiles from Cuba in exchange for the United States' promise to never invade Cuba.

options.label: C
options.text: The United States would invade Cuba in exchange for the Soviet withdrawal from Cuba.

options.label: D
options.text: The Soviet Union would invade the United States in exchange for the removal of U.S. missiles from Turkey and Italy.

multiple-choice.question: Who was the second-in-command on the Soviet submarine that was hit by a U.S. Navy vessel during the Cuban Missile Crisis?

options.label: A
options.text: Vasili Arkhipov

options.label: B
options.text: Nikita Khrushchev

options.label: C
options.text: Robert Kennedy

options.label: D
options.text: Anatoly Dobrynin

multiple-choice.question: What was the defense readiness level set by the U.S. Military during the Cuban Missile Crisis?

options.label: A
options.text: DEFCON 1

options.label: B
options.text: DEFCON 2

options.label: C
options.text: DEFCON 3

options.label: D
options.text: DEFCON 4

multiple-choice.question: What was the outcome of the Cuban Missile Crisis?

options.label: A
options.text: The United States invaded Cuba.

options.label: B
options.text: The Soviet Union withdrew its missiles from Cuba without any agreement.

options.label: C
options.text: The crisis was resolved with the Soviet Union agreeing to withdraw its missiles from Cuba in exchange for the United States' promise to never invade Cuba.

options.label: D
options.text: The crisis escalated into a full-scale nuclear war.

title: Why are there so many types of apples? - Theresa Doud

multiple-choice.question: What is the main reason for the huge diversity of apple varieties in the world?

options.label: A
options.text: Apple trees have been naturally evolving over thousands of years.

options.label: B
options.text: Humanity's efforts to breed new fruit have led to this diversity.

options.label: C
options.text: The climate and soil conditions in different regions have led to this diversity.

options.label: D
options.text: The genetic makeup of apple trees has changed over time.

multiple-choice.question: What is the process called when a breeder transfers pollen from one bloom to another?

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: Seed production

options.label: D

options.text: 10 years

options.label: D
options.text: 15 years

title: How Americans got stuck with endless drug commercials

multiple-choice.question: What is the main reason why direct-to-consumer prescription drug ads are allowed on TV in the US?

options.label: A
options.text: The FDA has strict regulations that require ads to include all the information about the drug's risks and side effects.

options.label: B
options.text: The FDA clarified that the industry could run full drug ads without giving all the risk information from the label, as long as they included major side effects and referred viewers to another source.

options.label: C
options.text: The American Medical Association has called for a ban on these ads.

options.label: D
options.text: The pharmaceutical industry is not allowed to market their products directly to consumers.

multiple-choice.question: What was the result of a study that tested the effect of direct-to-consumer ads on doctor-patient interactions?

options.label: A
options.text: Doctors were less likely to prescribe medications to patients who mentioned seeing ads on TV.

options.label: B
options.text: Doctors were more likely to refer patients to a mental health consultation if they mentioned seeing ads on TV.

options.label: C
options.text: There was no significant difference in doctor-patient interactions between patients who mentioned seeing ads on TV and those who did not.

options.label: D
options.text: Doctors were less likely to take patients seriously if they mentioned seeing ads on TV.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main argument against direct-to-consumer prescription drug ads?

options.label: A
options.text: They can be misleading and create unrealistic expectations about what pharmaceuticals can do.

options.label: B
options.text: They can be too expensive and not actually more effective.

options.label: C
options.text: They can be bad for public health by promoting the use of medications for conditions that may not require them.

options.label: D
options.text: They can be confusing and difficult to understand.

multiple-choice.question: What is the strongest argument in favor of direct-to-consumer prescription drug ads?

options.label: A
options.text: They can be good for public health by educating people about the fact that certain conditions can be treated.

options.label: B
options.text: They can be good for public health by getting people to visit their doctor and undergo necessary health screenings.

options.label: C
options.text: They are protected by the First Amendment and are therefore entitled to free speech protections.

options.label: D
options.text: They can be good for public health by reducing the cost of medications.

multiple-choice.question: What was the result of a study that looked back at 10 years of testosterone prescriptions?

options.label: A
options.text: Only 10% of prescriptions had been diagnosed with hypogonadism in the previous year.

options.label: B
options.text: Only half of prescriptions had been diagnosed with hypogonadism in the previous year.

options.label: C
options.text: 90% of prescriptions had been diagnosed with hypogonadism in the previous year.

options.label: D
options.text: There was no significant difference in the number of prescriptions that had been diagnosed with hypogonadism in the previous year.

title: What's the ultimate campfire fuel?

options.label: B
options.text: Combustion

options.text: Oxidation

options.label: D

options.label: C

options.label: D

title: What is a vector? - David Huynh

multiple-choice.question: What is a scalar?

options.label: A
options.text: A quantity with magnitude and direction.

options.label: B
options.text: A quantity with magnitude but no direction.

options.label: C
options.text: A quantity with direction but no magnitude.

options.label: D
options.text: A quantity with neither magnitude nor direction.

multiple-choice.question: What makes vectors special and useful in various fields?

options.label: A
options.text: They change based on perspective.

options.label: B
options.text: They remain invariant to the coordinate system.

options.label: C
options.text: They are only used in two-dimensional spaces.

options.label: D
options.text: They are only used in three-dimensional spaces.

multiple-choice.question: What is an example of a second-order tensor?

options.label: A
options.text: A vector with magnitude and direction.

options.label: B
options.text: A scalar with magnitude but no direction.

options.label: C
options.text: Stress, which is a combination of force and orientation.

options.label: D
options.text: A tensor with no magnitude or direction.

multiple-choice.question: What is the relationship between vectors and tensors?

options.label: A
options.text: Vectors are a type of tensor.

options.label: B
options.text: Tensors are a type of vector.

options.label: C
options.text: Vectors and tensors are both types of scalars.

options.label: D
options.text: Vectors and tensors are related but distinct concepts.

multiple-choice.question: What is the term for the process of assigning a coordinate basis to an array to give it meaning as a vector?

options.label: A
options.text: Coordinate transformation.

options.label: B
options.text: Vector assignment.

options.label: C
options.text: Basis assignment.

options.label: D
options.text: Array representation.

title: How the Band-Aid was invented | Moments of Vision 3 - Jessica Oreck

multiple-choice.question: What was the initial problem that Earle Dickson faced at home?

options.label: A
options.text: His wife was not using the large surgical dressings for minor cuts and burns.

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

multiple-choice.question: What was Earle Dickson's brilliant solution to the problem of the adhesive part sticking together?

options.label: C
options.text: He used a different type of gauze.

options.label: D
options.text: He used a machine to separate them.
